channel.title: How to rip templates from Template Monster
channel.description:
Okay lets start off by going to [url=http://Templatemonster.com]Templatemonster.com[/url]
1)Find a nice flash template in the flash template section of Templatemonster [img]http://www.templatemonster.com/themes/default/images/logo_chrst_text.jpg[/img]
2)View the live demo of your template [img]http://i40.tinypic.com/rtm4cj.jpg[/img]
3)When on the live demo page view the source code of the live demo page [img]http://i42.tinypic.com/20uqu1e.jpg[/img]
4)While on the live demo source code page search for something called iframe61 it should be around 60% down into the source code. [img]http://i40.tinypic.com/2vluu52.jpg[/img]
5)After the iframe61 is a line with http://images.templatemonster.com/screenshots/(category)/(template #).html [img]http://i39.tinypic.com/rc93pz.jpg[/img]
6)Copy that line of code and paste it into a new tab/window this will open up the flash template in a new window [img]http://i39.tinypic.com/zvbjmo.jpg[/img]
7)When at the new window change .html to .swf [img]http://i42.tinypic.com/fvlklv.jpg[/img]
8)Now install a program called FlashGet [img]http://www.flashget.com/en/images/logo-enkuaiche.gif[/img]
9)FlashGet can be found at [url=http://www.flashget.com/en/download.htm]http://www.flashget.com/en/download.htm[/url] [img]http://i44.tinypic.com/2zguj5g.jpg[/img]
10)Copy the link with the .swf and add it as a download to FlashGet [img]http://i39.tinypic.com/1z2n1xg.jpg[/img]
11)Now you need an swf decompiler I use Flash Decompiler 3 by Trillix [img]http://www.flash-decompiler.com/images/screenshots/1/1.jpg[/img]
12)now all you do is convert your swf file to fla in the swf decompiler [img]http://i43.tinypic.com/2je9qpz.jpg[/img]
13)Now you have full control over the flash template which you can edit in Adobe Flash [img]http://reviews.cnet.com/i/ss/2008/0922_Adobe_CS4_Flash_Slideshow/33255268_OVR_440.jpg[/img]

@ownagesbot wrote:

programs like web reaper are useful, you hand them a page and they will dl and organise all the files/pages for you. Also, whoever mentioned that site that is just an image, just dl it and then slice it up in photoshop, shud take like 5 mins

item.dc:creator: @mwiebelhaus mwiebelhaus
item.description:
@mwiebelhaus wrote:

[quote=“xx matty xx, post:14, topic:264252”][quote author=user087 link=topic=348969.msg3199101#msg3199101 date=1273127085]
Hi everyone!

I would like to know if anyone of you know how to rip CSS/HTML templates from template monster (that is not flash).

I’m specifically interested in:

http://osc.template-help.com/wt_27932/index.html

I’m trying to download the images, like background image, css file etc. But template monster have done a good job preventing people from accessing these files.

Does anyone have the skills?

Thanks for reading
[/quote]that’s because the whole page is a picture you moron[/quote]
LOLOL FKN LOL

Read full topic

item.title: How to rip templates from Template Monster
item.dc:creator: @Greg_the_Xeno Greg the Xeno
item.description:
@Greg_the_Xeno wrote:

[quote=“Ske, post:4, topic:264252”][quote author=goatee link=topic=348969.msg2683467#msg2683467 date=1235520613]

GREAT, i’ll definatly use this.

one question though, can they sue me or something if i use this without paying?
I mean it would be impossible to know if i ordered the template or not right?

They wouldn’t sue you, they’d probably just contact you if they were pissed off and tell you to get rid of it. Just edit it beyond recognition… or change the colours :P.

Nice tutorial for taking advantage of peoples hard work!
[/quote]
But how would they know i didn’t buy it?[/quote]

They wouldn’t if you edit it good enough. you could edit it or have someone edit it for you like a rl friend or something.

Read full topic

item.description:
@the_bank wrote:

Okay lets start off by going to Templatemonster.com

1)Find a nice flash template in the flash template section of Templatemonster

2)View the live demo of your template

rtm4cj.jpg1023×554

3)When on the live demo page view the source code of the live demo page

4)While on the live demo source code page search for something called iframe61 it should be around 60% down into the source code.

2vluu52.jpg803×602

5)After the iframe61 is a line with http://images.templatemonster.com/screenshots/(category)/(template #).html

rc93pz.jpg1192×1599

6)Copy that line of code and paste it into a new tab/window this will open up the flash template in a new window

7)When at the new window change .html to .swf

fvlklv.jpg776×186

8)Now install a program called FlashGet

9)FlashGet can be found at http://www.flashget.com/en/download.htm

10)Copy the link with the .swf and add it as a download to FlashGet

1z2n1xg.jpg399×540

11)Now you need an swf decompiler I use Flash Decompiler 3 by Trillix

1.jpg845×681

12)now all you do is convert your swf file to fla in the swf decompiler

13)Now you have full control over the flash template which you can edit in Adobe Flash
